result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Saal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.

supervisions.notes: Subject to Good Time & Work Release.

CASES: 14CF239, 14CF426, 16CF40, 16CF120. Defendant David A Saal in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant David A Saal in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RL-clerk 10:43 am.  Atty Petros- no corrections on PSI.  ADA addresses ct. Atty Petros addresses ct 10:55 am. Atty's open to read/review letter from def to Judge not previously read. 11:02 off record. 11:05 am back on. Atty's do not object to def's letter. Exh 1 Impact statement- O&R. Exh 2 booking report- 0&R. Exh 3 letter from def- O&R.  Def's father addresses ct.  Def addresses ct.  CT- states previous motion to forfeit bond filed May 2016- asks if agreement between parties to withdraw motion to forfeit bond if bond is used to pay towards restitution. Atty's agree. CT approves agreement, bond paid on file to be paid towards restitution. Off record 11:16 am. Back on record 11:33 am.  

14CF239:  Ct 1- 7 years prison- 4 yrs init conf, 3 yrs ext superv, imp/stayed. probation 3 yrs, restitution $1,217.54 plus 10% surcharge Jaris Johnson. DNA sample and surcharge. fine $290.60. AS, no new crimes. No contact with home at 406 220th Ave, Polk Cty WI. 



14CF426: w/h sent 3 years probation 290.60 dna sample and surcharge. Resitution $2300.00 to Marvin Coleman plus 10% surcharge. No contact with Marvin Coleman. Restiution is joint/several with restitution with Aaron Black in 14cm515.

16CF40:  Ct 1- w/h sent 3 yrs probation. Def must follow probation rules on all cts/files. Fine $290.60, dna sample and surcharge.  CT 3- 1 year PCJ, subj GT and WR, credit for 113 days against the 1 year sentence.   

16CF120: Ct 1-  w/h sent 3 yrs probation. Fine $290.60 dna sample and surcharge. CT 3- dna sample, $290.60 fine, (CT orders only 1 dna surcharge per file). $2500.00 bond to be applied to victim resitution. Orders JOC to be amended once new DC31 by DA file to remove surcharge. Fines payable through COCC- def to set up PP within 60 days. FTP- judgment.  PCR. 12:12 pm.

CASES: 14CF239, 14CF426, 16CF40 & 16CF120. Defendant David A Saal in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 3:36 pm. CT-revoking bond, order test be provided.  If clean, court will consider revocation of bond.  If not clean, will have another hearing.  Def remanded into custody.  3:42 pm adj.
